{{disambig-more|Kiryandil|[[Ciryandil (disambiguation)]]}} {{infobox character | people=[[Gondorians|Gondorian]] | name=Kiryandil | image= | caption= | pronun= | othernames= | titles= | position= | location=[[Gondor]] | affiliation= | language= | birth=late {{TA}} | birthlocation= | rule= | death=''Possibly'' before {{TA|1960}}In the ''Manuscript A'' of the Southern Line, it is said that Eärnil, Kiryandil's son, became the [[King of Gondor]] in {{TA|1960}}. Therefore, it is possible that Kiryandil was dead by that time, since otherwise he might have become the new king instead. | deathlocation= | age= | notablefor= | house= | parentage=[[Siriondil (son of Calimmacil)|Siriondil]] | siblings= | spouse= | children=[[Eärnil II]] | gender=Male | height= | hair= | eyes= | clothing= | weapons= | steed= }} '''Kiryandil''' was the father of [[Eärnil II]], according to a draft version of the ''[[Appendices]]''. In an early [[Manuscript A (The Southern Line)|manuscript]] of what would become the ''[[Appendix A]]'' of ''[[The Lord of the Rings]]'', Eärnil II was presented as the son of a man called Kiryandil, who was in turn the son of [[Siriondil (son of Calimmacil)|Siriondil]], son of [[Calimmacil|Kalimmakil]],The forms ''Kalimmakil'' and ''Narmakil'' are earlier spellings of ''Calimmacil'' and ''Narmacil'', respectively. son of king [[Narmacil II|Narmakil II]].{{PM|Elendil}}, Commentary, ''The Southern Line of Gondor'', entry '''Eärnil II''', pp. 216-7 However, soon after, the character of Kiryandil disappeared completely, and Eärnil instead became the son of Siriondil, son of Kalimmakil, son of Narmakil II.{{PM|Elendil}}, ''The Southern Line of Gondor: the Anárioni'', entry 32 '''Eärnil II''', p. 201 Ultimately, however, in the published version of the ''Appendix A'', the genealogy of Eärnil changed once again - there he is described as the son of Siriondil, son of Calimmacil, son of [[Arciryas]], a newly created character envisioned as the brother of king Narmacil II.{{App|Gondor}}, p. 1050 == Etymology == For the meaning of the name ''Kiryandil'', see [[Ciryandil#Etymology]]. == Genealogy == {{familytree/start}} {{familytree | NAR |NAR=[[Narmacil II|Narmakil II]]
